pull.title: build: pass sanitize flags to instrument libsecp256k1 code
pull.body:
secp256k1 functions are now instrumented:
```bash
# objdump --disassemble-symbols=_secp256k1_xonly_pubkey_serialize src/test/fuzz/fuzz | grep sanitizer_cov
100eb5244: 73 5d 01 94 	bl	0x100f0c810 <___sanitizer_cov_trace_const_cmp8>
100eb53f0: cc 5c 01 94 	bl	0x100f0c720 <___sanitizer_cov_trace_pc_indir>
100eb5418: c2 5c 01 94 	bl	0x100f0c720 <___sanitizer_cov_trace_pc_indir>
100eb5444: b7 5c 01 94 	bl	0x100f0c720 <___sanitizer_cov_trace_pc_indir>
```

Not sure if this is the best solution. Would fix #27990.

* [#28202](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28202) (Silent Payments: implement receiving by josibake)
* [#28201](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28201) (Silent Payments: implement sending by josibake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Is it guaranteed that sanitizer flags for a C++ compiler are acceptible by a C compiler?

Concept ACK

All of the CI tasks that make use of the `integer` sanitizer are probably gonna fail.

issue.title: Silent Payments: Implement BIP352
issue.body:
This PR is a sub-section of https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27827 and only implements the BIP logic without the wallet code. For the full PR with wallet logic, take a look at https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27827 .

This PR focuses strictly on the BIP logic and attempts to separate it from the wallet and transaction implementation details. This is accomplished by working directly with public and private keys, instead of needing a wallet backend and transactions for testing. Labels for the receiver are optional and thus deferred for a later PR.

Test vectors from the BIP are included as unit tests.

Before reviewing, it is strongly recommended you read https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1458 and take a look at the reference python implementation on the BIP.

events.body: Maybe mark as draft for as long as CI is red?
FWIW, CMake [works](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/27990#issuecomment-1646846003) out of the box :)

issue.title: test: Add UBSan `-fsanitize=integer` suppressions for `src/secp256k1` subtree
issue.body: Required for https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27991 (see the [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27991#issuecomment-1611472816)) and for the upcoming CMake-based build system.

events.body:
> Maybe mark as draft for as long as CI is red?

When does CI happen? Why would CI be red in this case?

issue.title: Silent Payments: implement receiving
issue.body:
This PR depends on #28122 and is marked as a draft until it is merged. Commits up to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/8ee791e7b34a354ce6835b968fe12924b8908d7c belong to #28122; please review those commits on #28122

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1956,7 +1957,11 @@ CPPFLAGS_TEMP="$CPPFLAGS"
 unset CPPFLAGS
 CPPFLAGS="$CPPFLAGS_TEMP"
 
+if test "$use_sanitizers" != ""; then
+ac_configure_args="${ac_configure_args} --disable-shared --with-pic --enable-benchmark=no --enable-module-recovery --disable-module-ecdh CFLAGS=${SANITIZER_CFLAGS}"
comments.body: Won't this lose the other `CFLAGS` currently passed by the user?
